subject: Re: [junit] Re: what is the order of Executon of Test Methods in a Test Class
msgSnippet: ... [snip] ... You may not want to remove it, though.  If the error you made was common enough that it could be done again unknowingly, you may want to leave
messageBody:
--- Shane Celis <shane@...> wrote:
> If you do find a problem with running two tests and want to repeat
> that behavior, then make a third composite test.
[snip]
> The tests should be rewritten so that they do not interfere with each
> other, so that the composite test "testAafterB" can be safely
> removed.

You may not want to remove it, though. If the error you made was
common enough that it could be done again unknowingly, you may want to
leave it in, with documentation describing the problem...

Kevin
